net.floodlightcontroller.routing

Class RoutingManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.floodlightcontroller.routing.RoutingManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFloodlightModule, IFloodlightService, IRoutingService

    public class RoutingManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IFloodlightModule, IRoutingService
    Separate path-finding and routing functionality from the topology package. It makes sense to keep much of the core code in the TopologyInstance, but the TopologyManger is too confusing implementing so many interfaces and doing so many tasks. This is a cleaner approach IMHO. All routing and path-finding functionality is visible to the rest of the controller via the IRoutingService implemented by the RoutingManger (this). The RoutingManger performs tasks it can perform locally, such as the handling of IRoutingDecisionChangedListeners, while it defers to the current TopologyInstance (exposed via the ITopologyManagerBackend interface) for tasks best performed by the topology package, such as path-finding.
    Author:
    rizard

    • Nested Class Summary

      • getPathsFast

        public java.util.List<Path> getPathsFast(org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.DatapathId src,

      • getPathsFast

        public java.util.List<Path> getPathsFast(org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.DatapathId src,
                                         org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.DatapathId dst,
                                         int numReqPaths)
        Description copied from interface: IRoutingService
        This function returns K number of paths between a source and destination **if they exist in the pathcache**. If the caller requests more paths than available, only the paths already stored in memory will be returned. See IRoutingService.getPathsSlow(DatapathId, DatapathId, int) to compute additional paths in real-time. The number of paths returned will be the min(numReqPaths, maxConfig), where maxConfig is the configured ceiling on paths to precompute.
        Specified by:
        getPathsFast in interface IRoutingService
        Parameters:
        src - source switch
        dst - destination switch
        numReqPaths - the requested quantity of paths
        Returns:
        list of paths ordered least to greatest cost

      • getPathsSlow

        public java.util.List<Path> getPathsSlow(org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.DatapathId src,
                                         org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.DatapathId dst,
                                         int numReqPaths)
        Description copied from interface: IRoutingService
        This function returns K number of paths between a source and destination. It will attempt to retrieve these paths from the pathcache. If the caller requests more paths than are stored, Yen's algorithm will be re-run in an attempt to located the desired quantity of paths (which can be expensive). See IRoutingService.getPathsFast(DatapathId, DatapathId, int) or IRoutingService.getPathsFast(DatapathId, DatapathId) to retrieve the precomputed paths without the risk of additional overhead. The number of paths returned will be the min(numReqPaths, availablePaths), where availablePaths is the permutation of all possible paths in the topology from src to dst.
        Specified by:
        getPathsSlow in interface IRoutingService
        Parameters:
        src - source switch
        dst - destination switch
        numReqPaths - the requested quantity of paths
        Returns:
        list of paths ordered least to greatest cost

      • forceRecompute

        public boolean forceRecompute()
        Description copied from interface: IRoutingService
        Recompute paths now, regardless of whether or not there was a change in the topology. This should be called if IRoutingService.setPathMetric(PATH_METRIC) was invoked to change the PATH_METRIC **and we want the new metric to take effect now** for future getPathsFast() or getPath() function calls. This will allow other modules using IRoutingService path-finding to use paths based on the new metric if the other modules only use the "fast" path-finding API. One can use IRoutingService.getPathsSlow(DatapathId, DatapathId, int) if there is no urgency for the new metric to take effect and yet one would still like to see the paths using the new metric once or so. In this case, one need not invoke IRoutingService.forceRecompute().
        Specified by:
        forceRecompute in interface IRoutingService
        Returns:
        true upon success; false otherwise
